Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2014 08:27PM Nettie1964 wrote: I would like to add that after reading this thread, I didn't come across anyone who used the protocol that my RO used to protect my skin.   He was very adamant about using cornstarch powder and only that during treatment. I complied and sailed right through, no skin issues at all. Once done, he recommended an ointment which I used liberally even though there were no.issues.  And with that, I had NO skin issues at all.  My issues come from the damage done inside and I'm still having them.
Posts.Title: Long Term Radiation Side Effects 10+ years After? Barbarella60 Raebrewster1971

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2014 11:41AM Nettie1964 wrote: I'll post again!  I had terrible rib pain and it ended up being cording!  Had OT for it and it worked right out!  However, I'm still sore upon the "stretch" and I have terrible pain toward my right shoulder in the back to the middle of my back!  Scared to death it's bone mets, but MO, OT and chiropractor all say it's from what the radiation did to muscle, tendons and fascia!  Plus that is the same side that I have pretty bad scoliosis, however, I never had pain before the rads!   I'm praying that they are correct and I'm hoping the pain eases with time!  I did have one of the ladies here suggest massages, which as soon as I'm financially able, I will look into! Sorry, so many have had to deal with pain!  Best of luck to all!
Posts.Title: Long Term Radiation Side Effects 10+ years After? Barbarella60 Raebrewster1971

Posts.Content: May 22, 2014 07:31AM Nettie1964 wrote: All that sounds completely normal to me!  I'm almost a year out of treatment and I still have those moments, hours, days!!  Give yourself time to adapt!!

Posts.Content: May 13, 2014 10:43AM Nettie1964 wrote: Well, once again, I've proven to be the exception to the rule! LOL  My hair is growing in at the crown much more than around my face or in back!  Leave it to me to be the odd ball!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2014 11:04AM Nettie1964 wrote: I'm not sure if I'm in the right thread - but my hair started coming back while I was taking the 12 weekly taxol!  Very very slow and kind of wiry.  I finished chemo in August 2013 and my hair is only 2" in some places and not even an inch in others.  Seems the crown of my head is the fastest growing with the part the touches my forehead the slowest at still only maybe 1/2 inch!  However, I did, just this past weekend have to get some "ends" cut from the back as they were coming in "very unruly" and I just couldn't take it!  I was never a wig wearer, just kept caps on, and the minute I had a slight covering, I stopped even wearing the caps! I think it was about a month and 1/2 after my last treatment!  I have always worn my hair at shoulder length, but I'm getting compliments on the short style, so I may just keep it! But I do have a question, have any of you had soreness on your scalp as the hair is coming in.  I don't really know how to describe it, it's just every now and then, as I pass a comb or brush it is a little painful, yet when I try to find the spot with my hand, I can't seem to find it!  Weird, I know!  Just wondering if there were any others that experienced this. Kennette
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 7, 2014 02:18PM Nettie1964 wrote: Yes, I love the Insomniacs threads also, I'm not as clever as most of them, but I do enjoy reading it!! My MO is the same as far as test or scan, only if symptoms warrant and so far, nothing I've complained about has warranted a scan! I'm just so ready for the weird aches/pains to stop!!  I am so not the one to run to the DR. for everything and I hate the fact that now I may have to!   I have searched these threads over and over trying to find all the side effects that may be possible from treatment and I think I have them all!   I guess, since I breezed through treatment, I'm going to have my misery after the fact!    I'm just hoping that I don't overlook something that needs attention, it's just so hard knowing!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 6, 2014 09:48AM Nettie1964 wrote: Just going to jump in on this thread, I've posted this question on other threads, but thought I would try here!  Have any of you experienced pain from hair growth??  I noticed a tender scalp when I was losing my hair, but never thought it would be tender when the hair was growing.  I finished chemo in August 2013 and I still only have about 2 inches of growth!    But just in the last few weeks, my scalp has started hurting - it's not all the time, but it's there enough to make me wonder what's going on!

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2014 09:59AM Nettie1964 wrote: Well, I have read this forum a  few times, but I don't think I've ever posted!  I'm in a weird situation!  When I was diagnosed in Nov 2012, not one time did I ever panic or have waiting anxiety over test!  It was eerily weird how calm I was!  Made it through 2013 with the chemo and rads ( not a bad experience at all for me), but now, I see the MO today for follow up and I am so nervous it's ridiculous!  The nervousness is because of pain that I've been having in my back that my surgeon, my chiropractor, my OT and my MO believe is from radiation tissue and/or nerve and fascia damage trying to heal!  But for some reason, I can't get past it and I'm scared of any test/scans that he may order!  Also, I'm almost certain that a mammo will be ordered and the only reason this scares me is because my affected breast is still very tender and sore! Anyway, just venting!  Thanks for listening!
Posts.Title: Waiting and scared... pagemans Nettie1964

Posts.Content: May 20, 2014 09:45AM Nettie1964 wrote: slv58, I too was worried because my breast is still tender to the touch!  And my surgery was on Dec 12, 2012 and I finished rads Oct 4, 2013!  My tenderness did not get so bad until after rads!  I saw an OT for a while and she did some massaging but it was quite painful!  I also had cording but that was easily corrected for me!  I was also paranoid about the mammo, but believe it or not, it was tolerable for me, not nearly as painful as when the breast is massaged or touched! I'm beginning to wonder if the tenderness will ever go away!  I go to massage weekly and when he even get's remotely close to the breast, like around collar bone and underarm, that whole area is still very painful!  Just wondering if/when it will stop hurting!  I also wear compression cami most of the time, but found that on these hot days, it is almost unbearable! The other issue I have, and I had this before BC, I can NOT find a bra that does not either ride up or curl up under my breast creating extra undue pressure!  Therefore, when I wear a bra, I'm always pulling at it to unroll it or pull it down!
Posts.Title: Tired of hurting! Breast/Truncal Lymphedema??? steelrose glennie19

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2013 02:39AM Nettie1964 wrote: Just thought I'd post a comment for you, although I don't have seizure issues, I wanted you to know that I just took my second treatment and as of right now, the first one was the worst, but nothing near as bad as I expected!  I just slept a lot.  Took the treatment on Thursday, got Neulasta shot on Friday, didn't really get "down" until late friday, then I just hit the bed and stayed!  By Monday I was up and out the door to work!  this time, I was only down on saturday and I'm feeling almost normal this sunday afternoon!  I'm praying that this continues and I'll be praying for you also!

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2014 03:03PM Nettie1964 wrote: I was diagnosed in November 2012, Had surgery December 12, 2012.  Then due to some infection and complications from the infection, I did not start Chemo until March 14!  This is WAY past the recommendation!  I was told no more than 60 days!  And as you can see it was 90 for me!  Because of this, I have always wondered if a stray cell escaped and has been hiding from treatment just to rear its ugly head at some point!
Posts.Title: Can I delay treatment after surgery? goofytoo goofytoo

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2014 09:07PM Nettie1964 wrote: Before I was given the option, I had already had the lumpectomy!  The only benefit that I would have had by proceeding with Masectomy at that point, was that I MAY have been able to skip radiation!  So I opted to just continue with the chemo and radiation!  Looking back, if I had weighed out options before having lumpectomy, maybe I would have had the masectomy, it's just hard to say! I do know that if I have a recurrence and at the point to be lucky enough for it to be local, I will have the mastectomy!
Posts.Title: 2014 Making the Decision on Type of Surgery Tettel bdavis

Posts.Content: May 17, 2013 03:28AM Nettie1964 wrote: Just wondering what is your actual Breast cancer type?  I have triple negative, aggressive and I worry over every little pain!!  Especially pain in my ribs and back!  That pain has been intermittent for about 2 months!!  I've told my ON and he does not seem concerned!!  My tumor margins were clear and the sentinel node was negative, but I was diagnosed on Dec 12 and was not able to start treatment until March 7th due to other issues!  I ended up in the hospital with a severe colon infection, and my GI DR and ONCO seem to think the pains are still from this!  But that was in february!!  I just don't know anymore, I stay worried and confused!!  I've had an abdominal CT and I've had ultrasound of gallbladder, liver, pancreas, kidney, all clear!! I just wonder if I have some other tumor that wasn't picked up on either of these!! anyway, just know you are not alone in the wondering about pains.
Posts.Title: I am so confused about my symptoms… OneHungLo Mimi8
